intro: Sarothamnus grandiflorus, commonly known as the largeflowered thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in regions with mild, Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Sarothamnus grandiflorus is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
